title: How Many Calories Are in a Sushi?
meta_description: Learn how many calories are in a sushi piece, plus full nutrition breakdown, macros, and preparation tweaks for accurate tracking.
h1: How Many Calories Are in a Sushi?
assumptions: One piece of nigiri sushi (vinegared rice topped with raw fish like tuna or salmon, ~25-30g total); no dipping sauce or extras.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by fish type, rice portion, rice vinegar, and preparation; sushi rolls or maki differ significantly. Check restaurant info when available.

quick_answer.text: One piece of nigiri sushi provides about 50 kcal, mostly from rice carbs.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged or restaurant data.

faqs.q: How many calories are in a sushi piece?
faqs.a: About 50 kcal for one standard nigiri sushi piece.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a sushi?
faqs.a: Roughly 3 g protein per piece, mainly from the fish topping.

faqs.q: Do sushi pieces have a lot of carbs?
faqs.a: Yes, around 7.5 g carbs per piece, primarily from the rice.

faqs.q: How does a sushi roll compare to nigiri?
faqs.a: A full 6-piece roll has 200-300 kcal total; each piece ~40-50 kcal, but varies by filling.

faqs.q: Why does sodium vary in sushi?
faqs.a: From seasoned rice and soy; can reach 120 mg per piece or more with extras.
